pull.title: Remove unused and confusing CTransaction constructor
pull.body: The constructor is confusing and dangerous (as explained in the TODO), fix that by removing it.

events.body: I kind of wish `CreateTransaction` would simply return an `optional<transaction, …>` instead of the in/out parameters (of which one a reference to a transaction reference), that would make it easier to review.

events.body:
Thank, looks good to me now.
Code review ACK fac39c198324715565897f4240709340477af0bf

comments.body: It appears that the only functional change is that this is initialized to a NULL pointer now, instead of a reference to a dummy transaction. I wonder why this choice was made initially and whether this has any consequences (it might make some additional check/assertion needed).

`CWallet::CreateTransactionInternal` will initialize the transaction. If that fails we will return here early with `return Result::WALLET_ERROR`.

I can add an `Assert(tx_new)`, but I think it is not needed.

I'm confused by the `CWallet::CreateTransaction` code here. It makes a copy of the `tx` that is passed in:
```
CTransactionRef tx2 = tx;
```
If it's only an output parameter, why is it copied?

Sounds fair enough. But we also have a changepos in-out which seems coupled, so it is passing in a transaction in some cases?
@meshcollider @achow101 can you weigh in what is supposed to be happening here please.
changepos relates to vecSend to shuffle in the change output
Pushed a commit to fix the assignment typo

`tx2` is used so that the second `CreateTransactionInternal` isn't polluted by the results of the first `CreateTransactionInternal`. But `tx` itself isn't used within `CreateTransactionInternal` at all, so it should be fine to remove the copy.
ok, closing this discussion. Let me know if there is anything else you want me to address
